page.title: 07Local History at Hickleton.
page.content: Hickleton{church}was built in Saxon times.But the first major{church}was built in Norman times.The{church}has had to be almost rebuilt because of mining subsidence,{archaeologists being able to do interesting work. Sixty two corpses have been found outside,including children.Under the floor of the church were many burials from medieval times,including a{priest with a lead chalice and a ring.There was also the grave of an ancient Lord of the Manor with an effigy in stone. Doncaster and Sheffield museums have been interested in the treaures that have been found.The{priest}of the {church}is also a teacher.The{church has now had a concrete raft put under it to stop more damage being done by mining subsidence.The corpses are at Sheffield University to be examined before reburial at Hickleton.
